page.title: 21Goodyears Wolverhampton - a shadow of its past
page.content:
Goodyear in Wolverhampton had a slow demise from 1986

From a peak in 1971 of 5,500 it had already drppped to 3500.

The racing tyre division moved to America and then pulled out of Formula One.

In 2000 there was further decline with many staff moving to Tyre-Fort. (Was Fort Dunlop)

The main site was demolished in 2008 including the iconic tower.

At the moment only 500 staff work in the southern portion of the site.

The main site having a proposal for a large housing development.
Contribution by: Marie Griffiths
